medical_history.chief_complaint: Leg edema, hematuria, and acute renal failure.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Bilateral lower-leg edema developed approximately 1 month before admission, followed by a red rash on the feet. Symptoms worsened with antihypertensive medication adjustments and included worsening hypertension, dyspnea, subjective fevers, and shaking chills, with nonbilious vomiting and hemoptysis occurring six days before admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension, atrial fibrillation, an aortic aneurysm, intermittent hemoptysis, hepatic and renal cysts, benign prostatic hypertrophy, and a previous deep venous thrombosis treated with heparin.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of myocardial infarction at 58; mother died of breast cancer at 67; daughter has breast cancer; two children have diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.social_history: Current cigarette smoker (55 pack-years), occasional alcohol consumption, and retired from the construction industry. No illicit drug use.
